latestVersion.termsOfUse:
Licensed electronic resources are restricted to members of the MIT community and for the purposes of research, education, and scholarship. Under MIT's licenses for electronic resources, users generally may not:

  • redistribute the materials or permit anyone other than a member of the MIT community to use them
  • remove, obscure or modify any copyright or other notices included in the materials
  • use the materials for commercial purposes.
Users are individually responsible for compliance with these terms.
latestVersion.restrictions: Copyright 2004 United Nations.  All rights reserved.  Data on this disk may not be copied [beyond what is needed to download and manipulate the data for research] or disseminated in any form without the written permission of the United Nations.
latestVersion.termsOfAccess: MIT affiliates should access this dataset by logging into Dataverse and selecting Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
latestVersion.sizeOfCollection: Note: these data sets were originally housed on a CD-ROM in a series of zipped folders (to which the accompanying documentation refers).  They were extracted and mounted on the Harvard-MIT Data Center (HMDC) along with the zipped folders and the extraction software, so that the user can choose to download either individual data files or the zipped packages.  Documentation includes: Volume1_readmefirst.doc (information on files contained in the original CD), Volume1_introduction.doc (general information on concepts and definitions of items, etc.), Annex1.doc: (industry nomenclature), Annex2.doc (list of combination codes), Annex3.doc (table codes), and Annex4.doc (country codes and currencies).  Also included is Unpack.bat (command which operates “PKUNZIP”, decompressing all files with .zip extensions and placing them into a separate folder) and PKUNZIP.exe (unzip extraction program).  The collection also includes the following compressed, space-delimited files: Vol1.zip (records 1967-1993), Historic.zip (records 1953-1966), Index.zip: Index numbers (records from 1967 to 1991 [1980 = 100]), as well as Footnote.zip (footnotes in ASCII format).  These were extracted and mounted at HMDC along with the zipped folders, so that the user can choose to download either individual data files or the zipped packages.  The unzipped versions of the data files have the extension .dat; the footnotes has an extension .txt.

authorName.value: Economic Statistics and Classification Section, United Nations Statistics Division

dsDescriptionValue.value: The data represents the entire dataset of General Industrial Statistics collected by the Industrial Statistics Section of the United Nations Statistics Division. It covers the period 1953-1993.  Contains variables on the following topics: establishments, employees, wages, hours of work, output, costs, value added, gross fixed capital formation, value of stocks, industrial production.

fields.value: MIT affiliates should access this dataset by logging into Dataverse and selecting Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

fields.value: The data presented was derived from replies from yearly questionnaires distributed to countries’ statistical offices.  The index numbers of industrial production were obtained from replies to quarterly questionnaires.
